0.Summary: Partners with more experienced engineers to develop knowledge.;Gas Operations is focused on ensuring the safe and reliable flow of natural gas to our customers.;
JobDesc: Requisition ID # 104962
Job Category : Engineering / Science
Job Level : Individual Contributor
Business Unit: Gas Operations
Department Overview

Gas Operations is focused on ensuring the safe and reliable flow of natural gas to our customers. Gas Operations is responsible for all aspects of PG&E’s gas distribution and transmission operations, including planning, engineering, maintenance and construction, restoration and emergency response.
Position Summary

Provide engineering, technical support, equipment design, and project management for LNG/CNG assets including CNG stations, natural gas generators, and mobile compressions. Supports high priority work to reduce risks, improves processes and supports their implementation, improve equipment performance and reliability, perform condition assessments, troubleshoot, and resolve equipment problems.
This position is a DOT (Department of Transportation) covered classification and is subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening.
Position location is flexible to all PG&E service territories.
Job Responsibilities
Has basic knowledge of applicable principles, codes, regulations, polices, and procedures
Performs basic engineering work using established engineering tools, processes and practices to complete work assignments
Partners with more experienced engineers to develop knowledge
Assists with more complex projects
Leads small teams to address asset issues
Receives priorities and directions with regard to work performed from supervisor or manager
Reviews work performed with supervisor periodically
Completes well defined tasks independently
Qualifications
Minimum:
Bachelors Degree in Engineering or equivalent experience
CA Class C License, or equivalent
Ability to travel up to 40 percent of working time
Desired:
Experience in compressed natural gas
Experience in gas operations
EIT (Engineer in Training) Certification

1.Summary: The engineer will have experience analyzing aircraft structures, developing load cases, and preparing aircraft certification.;M.S./Ph.D. in relevant discipline.;
JobDesc: Joby Overview: Located in the redwoods near Santa Cruz, California, the Joby Aviation team has been steadily working toward our goal of providing safe, short-hop, fully electric air transportation that is accessible to everyone. Our vision is that of an air taxi that takes off vertically, then quietly and quickly carries you over the congestion below, giving you back that time you’d otherwise spend sitting in traffic. Technology has advanced to the point where designing and operating an all-electric aircraft is completely viable. Our team has been discreetly designing and flight testing this vehicle and is looking for talented engineers to see it through certification and production. Overview:

Joby Aviation is seeking a passionate stress engineer who believes in the ability of urban air mobility to positively impact our cities. This role is an exciting position within the structures engineering team, as it allows for the engineer to interface with many disciplines within the company and assume a major role in the design of the aircraft. Prototypes are designed quickly and efficiently, meaning attention to detail is critical. The engineer will have experience analyzing aircraft structures, developing load cases, and preparing aircraft certification
Responsibilities:
Conducting design trades, optimizations for final product configuration definitions considering safety, strength, weight, & producibility.
Extraction and utilization of finite element analysis internal loads data.
Detailed sizing, static, dynamic, damage tolerance, and modal analysis of major structural aircraft components utilizing both classical hand calculations and finite element analysis.
Composite ply stack optimization for weight reduction while maintaining manufacturing constraints.
Supporting design reviews and signing off on structural parts.
Overseeing and supporting structural tests, including definition, planning, requirements, and report writing.
Directly communicating with mechanical design, team, and integration teams.
Required:
B.S. in aerospace engineering, mechanical engineering, or another relevant discipline
3+ years of working experience in relevant industry
In-depth understanding of loading scenarios, free body diagrams, and structural behavior of aircraft components
Excellent problem-solving skills
Highly proactive attitude with the ability to manage multiple assignments
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Advanced proficiency in finite element analysis, including nonlinear static and dynamic analysis of composite structures or metallic structures
Ability to generate and review detailed analysis reports and aircraft type certification documents
Proficiency with CAD
Ability to work as part of a team in a fast-paced dynamic environment
Desired:
M.S./Ph.D. in relevant discipline
7+ years of working experience in relevant industry
Expert knowledge of Abaqus/CAE or Femap/Nastran
Experience performing analysis on aircraft primary structure
Strong understanding of composite laminate theory
Hands on experience working within aircraft certification program
Good understanding of composite materials and manufacturing processes
Excellent understanding of FAR Part 23 and 27 regulations
Experience with MRB
Experience with Dassault Systems CAD

2.Summary: ChargePoint is seeking a Junior Applications Engineer to help develop ChargePoint’s Open Network OnRamp program.;
JobDesc: About Us

With electric vehicles (EVs) expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.

Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on EV charging and established a business model that's been validated by more than a decade in business and thousands of customers. As now a public company, we remain focused on broadening our market leadership and building on years of innovation. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to build our all-electric future and dominate a trillion-dollar market.
Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.
Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.
Position Summary

ChargePoint is seeking a Junior Applications Engineer to help develop ChargePoint’s Open Network OnRamp program. This crucial role entails supporting product readiness of OCPP integrations with third party EVSE partners hardware and ChargePoint’s network. You will work directly with Product Management and Engineering to drive the direction of our products in order to support this key initiative. The Junior Applications Engineer will be responsible for providing product documentation, training material, and solving challenging technical problems. ChargePoint has a wide variety of partners and customers in this fast-paced industry.
Help define OnRamp partner product documentation and processes for ChargePoint Technical Support to manage supportability of OCPP stations
Assist OnRamp team with OCPP station integrations and testing
Provide Level 3 technical support for OnRamp production stations when escalated from Level 2 Customer Support
Perform onsite, online, or in-house training on various OnRamp related subjects
Assist with setup and creation of OnRamp product demonstrations
Support OCPP OnRamp Product Manager to develop new features and improve OCPP server infrastructure
Help manage OnRamp lab and station setup (connect AC feed, physically install stations, configure and provision stations)
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent discipline
1-2 years’ prior work experience in an application engineering or equivalent role
A track record of success in successfully delivering complex projects in cross-functional environments
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently
Good customer, vendor, partner management, and interpersonal skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Professional demeanor and excellent presentation skills
Familiarity with EV industry
Location
Campbell, CA

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.
If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.
ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.
Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.

3.Summary: We are looking for a detailed-oriented and experienced Engineer who can provide technical support to client projects and business development efforts as part of…;
JobDesc: We are looking for a detailed-oriented and experienced Engineer who can provide technical support to client projects and business development efforts as part of our growing environmental practice.
Responsibilities
Your job functions will include, but not be limited to:
Implementation of site characterization studies, feasibility studies, and engineering evaluations on soil and groundwater remediation and drinking water treatment projects
Preparation of design plans and specifications
Permitting support
Construction monitoring
Cost estimating
Field sampling
Project and task management
Communicating technical information to varied audiences (e.g., clients, staff, regulators, and stakeholders)
Supporting litigation or allocation matters
Procuring and managing subcontractors (e.g., laboratories, drillers, sampling crews)
Qualifications
B.S. or M.S. in environmental or civil engineering
5-10 years of professional experience in environmental investigation and remediation
Civil and environmental engineering experience that includes contractor management at environmental remediation sites
40-hour OSHA HAZWOPER Training Certificate
Demonstrated ability to evaluate project data to develop applicable design criteria and produce plans and specifications for site remediation applications

Design experience in remediation (soil and groundwater remediation systems/applications, vapor mitigation, sediment remediation, stormwater treatment systems, water treatment plants, and/or wastewater treatment plants).
Experience with the use and integration of ArcGIS, AutoCAD, advanced Excel, 3D visualization and graphics applications to support environmental engineering evaluations and designs
Demonstrated cost estimating experience
Experience in environmental field sampling plan development and execution (e.g., soil, soil gas, groundwater, sediments, stormwater, drinking water)
Experience with the field application of in situ soil and groundwater investigation and remediation technologies including design of field programs, pilot testing, and interpretation of results
Permitting experience is highly desirable
Groundwater, surface water, and stormwater modeling experience is a plus
Willingness to travel and work in the field
Strong familiarity with Microsoft Office products
Strong oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work successfully within multidisciplinary and diverse teams
A desire to grow both intellectually and professionally
Strong leadership skills
Competitive compensation is commensurate with experience. Salary range is $60,000 - $90,000, with potential for a yearly, performance-based bonus.

Integral Consulting Inc. provides an exceptional benefits package with company-subsidized insurance, and an exciting work environment with opportunities for significant professional growth. Benefits include partially subsidized medical, vision and dental insurance, 401(K) with a company-match of up to 4% of annual compensation, company-paid life and short- and long-term disability, and paid time off.

All offers of employment are contingent on candidates passing a background screening that includes employment history, criminal background, Federal Watch List, a drug and alcohol screening, and, if applicable, a degree verification. Candidates will receive a written notice of this requirement. All screenings will be done in accordance with all local, state, and federal laws.
We are proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer and are committed to a proactive program of affirmative action and diversity development.

Integral Consulting Inc. provides equal opportunity in all of our employment practices to all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race; color; religion; gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions); national origin; age; sexual orientation; disability; marital status; military, veteran, or Vietnam Era Veterans’ Readjustment Assistance Act protected veteran status; gender identity or gender expression; or any other category protected by federal, state, and local laws. 4.Summary: This role requires a wide range of knowledge and skill that includes developing detailed flight test plans for experimental CTOL/VTOL fly-by-wire aircraft,…;
JobDesc: Joby Overview: Located in Northern California, the Joby Aviation team has been steadily working toward our goal of providing safe, affordable, fully electric air transportation that is accessible to everyone. Imagine an air taxi that takes off vertically, then quietly and quickly carries you over the congestion below, giving you back that time you’d otherwise spend sitting in traffic. Technology has advanced to the point where designing and operating an all-electric aircraft is completely viable. Our team has been discreetly designing and flight testing this vehicle and is looking for talented individuals to see it through certification and high rate production. Overview:

Joby Aviation is seeking a passionate and driven Senior Flight Test Engineer to join our flight test team. This role requires a wide range of knowledge and skill that includes developing detailed flight test plans for experimental CTOL/VTOL fly-by-wire aircraft, executing testing as a Test Director, test data analysis, and oversight of junior Flight Test Engineers. The role involves planning and execution of both development and certification flight testing. Flight test at Joby Aviation is very fast-paced, and we are looking for an individual who can take charge of a team, work with system designers to develop test procedures, and deal with frequently changing test scenarios. Previous experience and/or training as a Flight Test Engineer is essential. Near-term flight testing is planned to be conducted from a remote location; applicants must be willing to spend time away from home. Flight Analyst DER or AR qualification is desired.
Responsibilities:
Develop test programs to strategically expand the envelope and capabilities of our vehicles from experimental development through certification flight test
Perform flight test planning, flight readiness reviews, flight briefs/debriefs, act as test director during test execution and perform post flight data analysis
Complete documentation in accordance with established company and FAA procedures
May perform launch and recovery tasks of aircraft which include ground operations, preflight items, ground observer responsibilities, and post flight items
May help develop flight manuals and supporting documentation necessary to operate the vehicles
Responsible for observing all laws, regulations and other applicable obligations wherever and whenever business is conducted on behalf of the Company
Expected to work in a safe manner in accordance with established operating procedures and practices
Other duties as assigned or required
Required:
FTE graduate of a recognized test pilot school, or equivalent on the job learning experience.
A minimum of 5 years experimental flight test experience as a Flight Test Engineer, preferably including VTOL or STOVL flight test, and/or in a civil certification environment
Bachelors of Science (Aerospace, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering) degree or equivalent experience and training
Excellent computer skills – proficiency with day to day applications used for email, word processing, etc, as well as data analysis experience using Matlab, Python, or similar.
Excellent interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with colleagues across a wide range of technical disciplines
Must be able to work both independently and on a team and be able to work extended hours and travel as required
Read and speak English proficiently
Desired:
Data analysis experience using Matlab, Python or similar
Strong technical and analytical skills
Experience of envelope expansion flight testing
Flight Analyst DER or AR

5.Summary: The Production Operation QA team is chartered to provide Quality Engineering and Inspection support to the manufacturing line, laboratories and chambers used to…;
JobDesc: Space technology connects millions of people around the world and we’re accelerating tomorrow’s breakthroughs to help our customers stay ahead in an ever-changing world. At Lockheed Martin Space, we are motivated by innovation and integrity. We believe that by applying the highest standards of business ethics and forward-thinking, everything is within our reach – and yours as a contributing member of the Space team. Space values your skills, training, and education. Come and experience your future!

We are seeking an energized individuals who are passionate about building the space technologies of tomorrow. We have an opportunity for a Quality Engineer supporting the Production Operations Quality Assurance organization supporting Santa Cruz Manufacturing and Test QA team located in Santa Cruz, CA. The Production Operation QA team is chartered to provide Quality Engineering and Inspection support to the manufacturing line, laboratories and chambers used to simulate space launch and operational environments for high value hardware development, qualification, acceptance, and production testing.
Summary of Key Duties for this position:

Audit, monitor, and witness test processes for compliance with requirements and keeping a watchful eye for risk opportunitiesAbility to participate in gathering of QA Engineering metrics gathering and compiling for higher level review.Bring value to the team by promoting Operational Excellence through proactive engagement, attention to detail, process discipline, as well as applying real-time lessons learned and stopping (seek to understand) when something doesn’t seem right. Work with the teams to identify and implement solutions that will allow the team to move forward while meeting requirements (team player).

Act as a POC/ Technical SME for Quality Engineering issues when the Lead Quality Engineer is unavailableCommunicate regularly with Manufacturing and Test counterparts, and proactively engage in issue resolutionParticipate in test failure/anomaly investigations and processing, MRB decisions, root cause analysis, and closed loop corrective action while identifying potential systemic causal relationshipsEnsure that strong QA shift pass-down notes are disseminatedPromote personnel and product safety within the work areasProvide training to other Quality Assurance personnel as needed, and support the needs of Quality Inspectors on the floorParticipate in document reviews (e.g. Test Procedure Adequacy Reviews, Peer Reviews, etc.), approvals, and conduct. Support TRRs, Pre-Test meetings, and task briefings, and AESOP Huddles

Provide quality engineering bench strength and provide support to various areas in the Santa Cruz Production Quality Assurance (PQA) Organization as requiredPosition requires a full commitment to support overtime, odd shifts (as required) and On Call requirements as dictated by operational needs.May be engaged with multiple groups to include testing and manufacturing
Typically employees in this position will have 5+ years of related experience

Lockheed Martin Space offers a total compensation package. Click here to learn more about Lockheed Martin’s competitive edge.

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in a technical discipline (e.g., engineering field), equivalent discipline (e.g., math, physics, chemistry, etc.) or equivalent experience/combined educationExperience with quality processes to include: root cause analysis, corrective actions, familiar with material review boardsExperience working in an assembly, integration and test/manufacturing processes and anomalies - hardware relatedFamiliar with test equipment, and have some background with test planning documentationKnowledge with Basic Q-Note/M-Notes or non-conformance system documentation processing with the ability to effectively capture technical data and actions from Failure Review Board dispositions and other eventsAbility to obtain the appropriate process skill certifications to perform the work (e.g. mate/de-mate, torque, etc.)Willingness to support odd shifts, weekends and holidays as required.US Citizen with the ability to obtain a Secret Security clearance

Quality Engineering experience (Integration and Test or Manufacturing and Production floor experience preferred)Experience working in SAP Production Orders/VECAMS,

Automation Framework (AF), and EPDMMaterial Review Board (MRB) experience. Current membership preferredDealing with a government customerKnowledge and experience troubleshooting components and assembliesDemonstrated commitment to continuous process improvementGreen Belt or Black Belt Trained or CertifiedActive Secret (or higher) clearance

job.Qualifications

Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. 7.Summary: You will ensure products meet or exceed performance and reliability targets and can be manufactured at scale.;Develop drawing packages for select products.;
JobDesc: The Role

Are you passionate about applying cutting-edge technology to develop exciting products for consumers while collaborating with cross-functional teams? As a Mechanical Engineer, at RPM Training, you will partner with our team in the product development process from concept to launch to develop new products and expand the life of the existing product line. You will ensure products meet or exceed performance and reliability targets and can be manufactured at scale. You will assist in designing and building test plans and inspect and analyze quality and visual specs. Must be passionate about building new and innovative products that align with the RPM philosophy, #GroundedByPurpose.
Some of the things you will do:
Work on new product development from concept to market release
Design and build prototypes for innovative products using SolidWorks and other CAD programs
Develop drawing packages for select products
Perform incoming inspections
Fit test T0 and T1 assemblies
Work with production to maintain manufacturing equipment

Conduct root cause analysis for the inspection of products and trouble-shoot accordingly to diagnose and create the best final product(s)Work closely with manufacturing to implement process improvements through automation and fixturing
Demonstrate technical expertise related to engineering design, layout, testing and evaluation of mechanical devices or systems
Provide recommendations and innovative solutions for new concepts and ideas related to the RPM product line
Coordinate and collaborate with other team members with a full understanding of cross-organizational impact and needs
Select appropriate materials based on environment and use case
Who you are:
Passionate about building things (both for work and as a hobby)
Excellent knowledge of SolidWorks and other CAD programs
Strong mechanical engineering skills, problem solving, trouble-shooting and communication skills
Strong understanding of materials and their performance attributes
Solid analytical skills, attention to detail, and relentless drive to identify risks and ensure resolution
Comfortable working in a fast paced environment
Requirements
4+ years of mechanical engineering experience designing consumer products
Excellent knowledge of SolidWorks and other CAD programs
Strong mechanical engineering skills, problem solving, trouble-shooting and communication skills
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent
Experience in design for manufacturability and assembly and familiar with production processes such as injection molding, cnc machining, laser processing, and welding
Bonus:
Prior shop experience
Demonstration of applied engineering principles within a hobby/passion outside of work
Prior experience participating in functional training
About Us

Founded in 2012, RPM was born out of the idea that legit, purposeful functional training is the foundation for a truly full and adventurous life. When you put in that work, it pushes you to do more, explore further, surf longer, ride harder... It's a barrier against injury, apathy, and even time itself. This connection is why our brand will always reflect the action, adventure, and creativity emboldened by the time we spend training, and not just the training itself. This purpose-first approach has been sorely missing from the traditional "fitness" brand landscape, but it permeates everything we do at RPM, and everything we make. #GroundedByPurpose
Eligibility:
You must be eligible to work in the US. Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor work visas at this time.

8.Summary: ChargePoint is looking for a creative and highly motivated Senior Vehicle Interoperability Engineer to help ensure that our products meet high design,…;
JobDesc: About Us

With electric vehicles (EVs) expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world's leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.

Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on EV charging and established a business model that's been validated by more than a decade in business and thousands of customers. As now a public company, we remain focused on broadening our market leadership and building on years of innovation. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to build our all-electric future and dominate a trillion-dollar market.
Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.
Discover what it's like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog .
Reports To
Senior Manager, Systems Engineering
What You Will Be Doing

ChargePoint is looking for a creative and highly motivated Senior Vehicle Interoperability Engineer to help ensure that our products meet high design, development, and production quality. The position will play a key role in driving many aspects of developing and testing high-quality systems, specifically involving interoperability with eVs and the associated charging standards.
What You Will Bring to ChargePoint
Focus on creating hardware and software to ensure high quality product designs at ChargePoint.
Knowledge of scripting with Python, and coding with Linux, C.
Solid understanding of electrical communication such as Ethernet, CAN.
Solid understanding of digital circuits, microcontrollers, and communication modules/chipsets.
Come up with detailed development test plan from eV charging standards and protocols, and actively take part in prioritizing testing needs.
Support Hardware Design Engineers in the product development with characterization testing and testing with vehicle emulators and eVs
Results oriented, hands-on mentality, and can-do attitude
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent industry experience.
6-8+ years of experience in development testing of digital electronics, and communication networks.
Experience using CAN Tools and analyzing CAN data
Experience using Ethernet, and software for analyzing packets
Ability to create and modify firmware in Linux, C; and program electronic platforms such as Arduino, Raspberry Pi.
Experience with working on high voltage systems (600Vac/ 1000VDC).
Needs to be hands-on with tools & modifications, adept with use of instrumentation such as Oscilloscopes, and data bus analysis tools.
Understanding of electric vehicle-related interface and communications standards such as CAN, SAE J1772, IEC 61851, ISO 15118, and CHAdeMO.
Location
Campbell, CA

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.
If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.
ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.
Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.
#LI-CPMS1

9.Summary: Besides designing the circuits, this engineer will also be responsible for running circuit simulations to verify that the circuits meet specifications and…;
JobDesc: Description

At Xilinx, we are leading the industry transformation to build an adaptable, intelligent world. ARE YOU bold, collaborative, and creative? We develop leaders and innovators who want to revolutionize the world of technology. We believe that by embracing diverse ideas, pushing boundaries, and working together as ONEXILINX, anything is possible.

Our culture of innovation began with the invention of the Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA), and with the 2018 introduction of our Adaptive Compute Acceleration Platform (ACAP), has made a quantum leap in capability, solidifying our role as the adaptable platform supplier of choice. From the beginning, we have always believed in providing inventors with products and platforms that are infinitely adaptable. From self-driving cars, to world-record genome processing, to AI and big data, to the world's first 5G networks, we empower the world's builders and visionaries whose ideas solve every day problems and improve people's lives.

If you are PASSIONATE, ADAPTABLE, and INNOVATIVE, Xilinx is the right place for you! At Xilinx, we care deeply about creating significant development experiences while building a strong sense of belonging and connection. We champion an environment of empowered learning, wellness, community engagement, and recognition, so you can focus on work that matters - world class technology that improves the way we live and work. We are ONEXILINX.

We are looking for a temporary contractor to design 300MHz IO circuits and clock generation/distribution circuits using 90nm CMOS technology. Besides designing the circuits, this engineer will also be responsible for running circuit simulations to verify that the circuits meet specifications and working with layout designers to lay out the circuits.
In addition, this contractor will support other team members in analog circuit verification and chip-level timing verification checks.
Work hours: Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm California time.
Duration: 12 weeks (with possibility of extending to 13 weeks)
Start date: First week of June, 2021
Minimum of MSEE with more than 5 years of industry experience in circuit design.
Must have hands-on experience in circuit design and have successfully designed/verified IO and analog circuits.
Must have experience working with layout designers to implement circuits.
Able to work independently and as a team.
Familiar with commonly used EDA tools, circuit simulators e.g. SPICE.

10.Summary: As a PCIe IP Application Engineer in the Programmable Solutions Group (formerly known as Altera) you will be responsible for providing proactive or reactive…;
JobDesc: Job Description

Intel is a global leader, creating world-changing technology that enables progress and enriches live. We are at the intersection of several technology inflections – artificial intelligence, 5G network transformation, and the rise of the intelligent edge- that together will shape the future of technology.

As a PCIe IP Application Engineer in the Programmable Solutions Group (formerly known as Altera) you will be responsible for providing proactive or reactive technical support to Intel PSG customers and sales teams in resolving challenging customer issues for PCIe. You will act as the technical subject matter expert for PCIe to our key customers in helping to resolve the challenges as they go from prototype to production. We value technical excellence customer focus integrity and teamwork.
Your specific role will have opportunity to, but not limited to the following:
Generate bring up of designs for next generation protocol IPs and Intel Interconnects, including PCIe Gen 345 and CXL
Participate in interoperability testing and compliance for protocol IPs Highlight protocol IP user models and demonstrate performance to customers
Create collaterals including protocol IP user guide reference designs technology demonstration tools and macro
Collaborate with cross functional teams in issue resolution protocol validation and providing feedback on protocol IPs quality and customer experience
Qualifications
Qualifications

You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.
Minimum Education Requirements:
Bachelors’ Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field
Minimum qualifications
3+ years of experience with bring up and debug of PCIe
Preferred Qualifications
Masters’ degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering with 2 years of experience in relevant course work in PCIe.
3+ years of experience in customer support or customer facing role
5+ years of experience with bring up of PCIe Gen 34
Experience with FPGA implementations in bringing up PCIe Gen 34
Experience with PCIe protocol validation compliance and protocol analyzer
Experience in interoperability compliance tests for PCIe
Inside this Business Group

The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.
Other Locations
US, Texas, Austin
Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.

11.Location: San Jose, CA 95129 (West San Jose area)
11.Summary: Our featured innovations include Apostle MagTouch Nucleic Acids Isolation Automation System, and Apostle MiniMax cfDNA technologies (as reported in Science, New…;
JobDesc: Company Description

Apostle is a provider of innovative technologies and services for public health and life sciences. Our featured innovations include Apostle MagTouch Nucleic Acids Isolation Automation System, and Apostle MiniMax cfDNA technologies (as reported in Science, New Products, 2019), among others.
Why work at Apostle

Opportunity – Apostle is a thriving startup located in the heart of Silicon Valley. This is an opportunity to become an early employee of an exciting and high energy pre-IPO Research and Development company.

Passion & Challenge – We are passionate about what we do and enjoy working with others who feel the same way. We embrace the challenge and hard work that come with working on the cutting edge. You are given the resources you need to succeed and the freedom to make it happen; in return, you will be rewarded as the company grows. We are looking for an enthusiastic person who understands and appreciates the entrepreneurial environment of a startup and who is willing to do what it takes to contribute to the success of the company.

Being part of a great team – We are a Stanford University StartX selected company; a BioSpace top 20 Startups to Watch (2018); a partner with Beckman Coulter Life Sciences; and our first wave of new product Apostle MiniMax is featured in Science, 2019;364(6441):696, New Products. Come join us.
Job Description

We are seeking a motivated individual for an Enzyme Engineer position that will specialize in protein R&D and manufacturing. This person will be expected to tackle a variety of cross-functional challenges as part of Apostle’s R&D team.
Required Qualifications
Ph.D. or Master degree in Bioengineering, Biochemistry, Microbiology, or a related field

Hands-on experience in enzyme or protein engineering, including experience in manufacturing one or more of the following proteins in a cGMP or lab setting: proteinase K, DNase, RNase, DNA polymerase, RNA polymerase, reverse transcriptase, antibodies.
Expertise in enzyme kinetics, variant library design, protein expression and qualification
Responsibilities
Design, construct, test, and manufacture proteins/enzymes for a variety of utilities
Build and screen libraries of enzyme variants
Work as part of a multi-disciplinary scientific team to implement experimental and manufacturing plans and achieve project goals; Communicate results of experiments with colleagues
Support cross-functional R&D, manufacturing responsibilities
Work style
Must be flexible to be able to apply her/his knowledge to new areas of study and responsibility
Must be flexible with day-to-day duties and able to thrive in a start-up environment
Must be well-organized and be able to handle multiple projects simultaneously
Must be a quick learner who is self-motivated and able to ask questions and seek clarity
Must be an excellent team member and a desire to work collaboratively
Strong verbal and written communication skills and willingness to collaborate cross-functionally in a fast paced and dynamic start-up company environment
Must hold him or herself to the highest professional, scientific and ethical standards
Primary Location
North America-United States-CA-San Jose
Website: www.apostlebio.com
How to apply
Send a CV to: hr@apostlebio.com

12.Summary: The Xilinx Board Operations team is looking for a bold, collaborative and creative Hardware Engineer to work on engineering design for cost optimization of our…;
JobDesc: Description

At Xilinx, we are leading the industry transformation to build an adaptable, intelligent world. ARE YOU bold, collaborative, and creative? We develop leaders and innovators who want to revolutionize the world of technology. We believe that by embracing diverse ideas, pushing boundaries, and working together as ONEXILINX, anything is possible.

Our culture of innovation began with the invention of the Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA), and with the 2018 introduction of our Adaptive Compute Acceleration Platform (ACAP), has made a quantum leap in capability, solidifying our role as the adaptable platform supplier of choice. From the beginning, we have always believed in providing inventors with products and platforms that are infinitely adaptable. From self-driving cars, to world-record genome processing, to AI and big data, to the world's first 5G networks, we empower the world's builders and visionaries whose ideas solve every day problems and improve people's lives.

If you are PASSIONATE, ADAPTABLE, and INNOVATIVE, Xilinx is the right place for you! At Xilinx, we care deeply about creating significant development experiences while building a strong sense of belonging and connection. We champion an environment of empowered learning, wellness, community engagement, and recognition, so you can focus on work that matters - world class technology that improves the way we live and work. We are ONEXILINX.

The Xilinx Board Operations team is looking for a bold, collaborative and creative Hardware Engineer to work on engineering design for cost optimization of our Xilinx Alveo boards and RF 5G platforms. As a Senior Staff Hardware Engineer, you'll be involved in the early design phase for all board platforms to optimize the architecture for cost by understanding hardware design, system architecture, and planned product use cases. You will work with the hardware development, platform marketing, and board operations teams on changes to the architecture specific to reducing cost.
Qualifications:
Main focus on Telecommunications Engineering desired
Hardware systems design experience
PCB (layout familiarity) and circuit design (schematic entry)
Server hardware boards (PCIe cards) for networking or acceleration
Cellular radio - baseband or radio
Board management functions (power, clocking, devices, etc.)
Knowledge of FPGAs / Xilinx FPGAs, SoC / MPSoC / RFSoC; design experience is a plus
High speed SerDes (JESD204, 25GE, 10GE) interfacing and design
Clocking of modern high-performance ASICs, ASSPs, and FPGAs, SoCs
RF hardware design and component selection experience
Signal integrity, power integrity, power supply, thermal/mechanical knowledge is a plus
Additional Skills
Team-oriented and self-dependent working style
Education Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related field with 12 plus years of relevant industry experience or Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or a related field with 8+ years of relevant industry experience.

13.Summary: This role will support the development of embedded controls for AC/DC and DC/DC power converters as well as state control and communication.;
JobDesc: About Us

With electric vehicles (EVs) expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.

Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on EV charging and established a business model that's been validated by more than a decade in business and thousands of customers. As now a public company, we remain focused on broadening our market leadership and building on years of innovation. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to build our all-electric future and dominate a trillion-dollar market.
Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.
Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.
Reports To
Power Electronics Firmware Manager
What You Will Be Doing

The Embedded Controls Engineer will work as a member of the DC Power Engineering group supporting DC fast charger development. This role will support the development of embedded controls for AC/DC and DC/DC power converters as well as state control and communication. The role will involve working with hardware, software, validation and system integration.
What You Will Bring to ChargePoint
Develop control models for single and three phase PFC AC-DC converters, LLC and phase shifted full bridge converters for robust closed loop control
Execute HIL and SIL simulations to verify control behavior and performance
Work with software development teams to integrate control software and validate system performance
Support system and sub-system level integration testing to ensure control system behavior meets functional requirements
Adhere to coding development standards and processes
Collaborate with product management and system integration teams
Participate in design and code reviews
Requirements
BS in Engineering or Computer Science
At 5 years’ experience in controls, power systems or software engineering required
Proficient in C/C++
Working knowledge of programmable logic design; VHDL and/or Verilog
Strong background in digital control techniques and loop stability analysis
Strong background in digital signal processing, digital filter design, DFT and Park/Clarke transform
Experience with real time operating systems and finite state machines
Proficient with modeling and analysis tools such as Matlab/Simulink, PLECs and SPICE
Experience with high level test languages such as LabView and C# a plus
Location
Campbell, CA

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.
If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.
ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.
Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.
